job_title: Policy Analyst in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Creating positive change with children and families.
cons: There are no cons to working here.

pros:
-People are very friendly and welcoming
-Training provided during first few weeks
-Materials provided to you for completing work 
-CEO is probably one of the best people I've ever had the pleasure to meet
-A lot of internal positions available to transfer at any time
cons:
-Deceptive work information in job description. Be upfront about the fact that only one major system is expected to be used that is very user unfriendly, confusing, and way too complicated for the hourly pay
-Pay is ridiculous for the workload and is offered twice a month but only on certain days of the week vs bi-weekly
you're granted paid sick time if you make it up to 3 months
-Everyone is overworked and have way too long work hours. This could also be seen as a positive because it makes the days fly by but do you really want that much stress?
-This position is extremely complicated, difficult to learn. I felt like I was thrown into the deep end with mixed information and complicated workload too fast after training
-Not enough training and on-boarding. Focus on real-life cases to train your incoming staff vs mixing up scenarios during training and then expecting new employees to figure things out on the fly 
-Information is disorganized and almost impossible to fully comprehend right away. Please focus on either reducing the verbiage to make everything more cohesive or hire more trainers who can explain the details in a step-by-step and logical manner 
-Families are low-income so sometimes you'll get pushy, rude families who expect you to work miracles even though they submit everything last-minute

pros: Full kitchen, supervisors offices have new carpeting and paint
cons: Bossy underqualified lead, disorganized, bad attitudes

job_title: Human Resources Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Non-profit, straightforward, clear expectations, caring environment
cons: No room for feedback, limited to the scope of duties

pros: Ok for everything. I like it
cons: Each company has its own pros and cons

job_title: Childcare Eligibility Specialist in Bonita, CA
pros: Company in continuous growing , with big opportunities of a career path
cons: Unpredictable times for new position

pros: Throughout training provided, family like culture
cons: A lot of work to do

review_title: A great place to work where you can see that you are helping people
pros: The work is rewarding because you are part of a company that is helping others and making a difference. If you want to have meaningful work, then this is a good place for you. The company has a very good medical plan for employees and a company funded 401K contribution each year. The people who work here are friendly and work together to get the job done. Great sick leave benefits and in addition to vacation accrual, employees with 3 years get 4 extra days off during Christmas week. The company has a few events each year for employees like a company picnic and holiday party. There is a lot of training opportunities and new employees can get promoted quickly. They work hard, but decorate the offices and dress up for Halloween!
cons: The company provide childcare to low-income families and there are a lot of rules to follow. The rules take time to learn for some jobs, but there is a training program and support from experienced employees.

job_title: Child Care Eligibility Specialist in San Diego, CA
pros: none...stay away. unless you want to work in a circus type of environment.
cons: hiring process is a joke. Seems like they will interview whoever for whatever position and then offer other positions while youre in the interview process. Management is a joke. All office in bonita and mission valley play favorites so if youre looking to get promoted by the work and effort you put in, its not going to happen. its all about who you know. Training is very unorganized and isn't taught by management or professionals. its whoever is available that day. was very uncomfortable with working with people who were uneducated, unprofessional and not caring when it comes to their job. they have so much turnover and its because  of the way they do things. company sucks to work with. by far the worse job I have ever had. not only because the hours, workload and low pay but they expect you to learn so much by a company that offers so little. this company is a joke.

review_title: You could do worse, but you could also do better
job_title: Child Care Eligibility Specialist in Chula Vista, CA
pros:
Fast-paced work day
Responsive IT staff
Cordial staff
Highly communicative company culture
Free business cards, coffee, and photo ID badge
Paid training
1/2 day off for annual Holiday party
Safe working environment
Low turnover
Company promotes from within
cons:
Unreasonably high expectations for productivity
Insufficient training period
Inadequate desk space
Inflexible work schedule
Complicated policies/procedures
Inadequate assistance/help with questions
Hourly staff has little input into management decisions
Limited access to resources such as internet
Cheap with office supplies
Having to double-up on workloads when a coworker is out

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros:
Great company culture, everyone working here is striving to create positive change. 

Some of the benefits to working for this agency include: 

Training and career development
Strengths assessment and development
Team building days
Birthday luncheons
Company picnics
Seasonal events for staff
Discounted gym membership at 24hour fitness for all staff
cons: There are no real cons to working at CDA. Everyone is very friendly and it's a nice work environment. Management care about the development of their staff and go out of their way to provide relevant trainings. The health care benefits are also fantastic.

pros: There are a lot of opportunities for growth. There are a lot of entry level positions that will allow you to get your foot in the door. Loyalty and hard work will pay off at this agency.
cons: Its non profit and with that comes a lot of work for less pay than some jobs. The plus is that you are helping families. If your definition of success is making more money than everyone else non profit is not the place for you.

job_title: Director of Finance in Bonita, CA
pros: Excellent work environment ,great leadership with clear expectations and fully involved in a day to day operations making it easy to accomplish the mission and vision of the institution, not to big to loose the personal touch and big enough to make you feel you are part of a big and important institution that is truly dedicated to help the families we serve and create a positive change.
cons: The only cons i can express is the lack of unlimited funds available to help and serve even more families in great need of services that we provide.

review_title: Great Organization/Does Great Work for Children & Families
pros: Many children and families throughout San Diego County are receiving child care assistance. Management is conscientious and understanding of parents and staff needs.  It's a great place for staff to work, learn and play.  The benefits are excellent.
cons: There are more people to help that the organization is unable to reach.

pros: CDA is a non-profit that supports families, children, and child care providers. They offer a great work environment with staff that care about making positive change in the community. CDA offers great benefits and compensation, as well as opportunities for professional growth.
cons: Serving thousands of families to create positive change in the community can get busy. If you are up for the challenge and want to make a difference, CDA is the place for you!

pros: As a long time employee, I have found that Child Development Associates truly values their employees and is very committed to their mission of helping families with child care and nutrition services.  While the agency maintains high standards and expectations of staff, the work environment is friendly and family focused.
cons: Limited state funding to serve all those in need of services.

pros: Intense training, good experience for recent grads.
cons: High work load, low pay grade.

review_title: High turn around and over worked
pros: Great coworkers and benefits are okay
cons:

A lot of reports on top of daily workload 
Only 5 vacation days in the first year
High turn around causes higher workload for experienced staff
Policies are often overlooked for parents who complain

pros: Great company!  Wonderful benefits! Staff have a passion for children and their well-being. Nice work environment.  I'm happy to be part of the CDA Team!
cons: Paid at non-profit rates of salary.

pros: Easy to learn. There is a lot of paperwork and files. Nice coworker's.  Lots of training and room for growth.
cons: There are a lot of cliques within the company but everyone is nice to each other. Always driving from Bonita to Sd for trainings.

review_title: I have had an ok experience with CDA
